items.title: Reddit Sued Perplexity for Data Scraping—and Compared the Startup to a ‘North Korean Hacker’
items.description: In a scathing filing, Reddit called Perplexity a “willing customer” of an illegal “data laundering” economy.

items.title: Jay Shetty Expands His Tea Brand Juni Into Whole Foods Stores Nationwide
items.description: The hit podcaster says his company is on track to end 2025 with 300 percent growth and eight figures in revenue.

items.title: How Your Company Can Retain Talent as Child Care Costs Drive Women Out of the Workforce
items.description: Rising daycare costs are driving half the working population off the job because they aren’t making enough to cover those costs.

items.title: Donald Trump Just Pardoned the Founder of Binance
items.description: Changpeng Zhao, founder of the crypto exchange, had been convicted of federal anti money-laundering violations.

items.title: To Increase Your Company’s Productivity, Make Sure Everyone Eats Lunch
items.description: Workers are increasingly skipping noon meals because of inflation and guilt about taking breaks.
